{{wiki_interaction_warning}}: Эта информация либо официально не проверена, либо только частично проверена, но была исследована многими сторонами
{{wiki_interaction_p1}}: Диапазон, в котором призрак может взаимодействовать с объектами, - это коробка, центрированная на призраке. Эта коробка может вращаться с движением призрака, позволяя призраку взаимодействовать с объектами на различных расстояниях, эффективно создавая взаимодействие «радиус».
{{wiki_interaction_p2}}: Диапазон взаимодействия для призраков и близнецов в два раза больше на больших картах.
{{wiki_interaction_p3}}: Расстояние от центра до края коробки взаимодействия составляет 1,5 м, что дает стандартному призраку эффективный радиус взаимодействия 2,12 м.
{{wiki_interaction_p4}}: Расстояние от центра до края коробки взаимодействия составляет 6 м, что дает близнецам эффективный радиус взаимодействия 8,48 м.
{{wiki_interaction_p5}}: Расстояние от центра до края коробки взаимодействия составляет 3 м, что дает стандартному призраку эффективный радиус взаимодействия 4,24 м.
{{wiki_interaction_p6}}: Расстояние от центра до края коробки взаимодействия составляет 12 м, что дает близнецам эффективный радиус взаимодействия 16,97 м.
{{wiki_interaction_disclaimer}}: Zero-NetWork будет продолжать ссылаться на эти диапазоны на шпаргалку и исследователе карты в качестве радиуса, используя эффективный радиус каждого диапазона.
{{wiki_interaction_research}}: You can view Zero-Network's research here.
{{wiki_obake_blinking_p1}}: Во время охоты об OBAKE изменит модели на заранее определенных миганиях: 12, 27, 39, 54, 62, 80, 105, 120 и 132.
{{wiki_obake_blinking_p2}}: Это означает, что Obake не гарантированно будет связан с охотами, которые короче, чем около 8 с, поскольку охота должна быть достаточно длинной, чтобы призрак достиг 12 миганий.
{{wiki_obake_blinking_p3}}: Смотрите видео ниже, показывающее изменения модели OBAKE на конкретных миганиях:
{{wiki_obake_blinking_p4}}: У Obake есть шаблон, которой он будет следовать при изменении моделей. Мужская модель превратится только в другие мужские модели, в то время как женская модель будет только превращаться в другие женские модели. Паттерн для каждого одинаковый, и самое первое изменение модели всегда будет одной и той же моделью. Образец не сбрасывается между охотой. то есть, если бы последнее изменение модели в охоте было бабушкой, следующим изменением модели в следующей охоте было бы терпеливым 07.
{{wiki_obake_blinking_p5}}: Мясник >> клуб / рыбак >> greybeard >> naked >> nerd >> skeleton >> Брут >> (Повторите ...)
{{wiki_obake_blinking_p7}}: Обоиз также будет превращаться в себя, когда его собственная модель является следующей моделью в шаблоне, которая обычно визуализируется сбросом в осанке.
{{wiki_obake_fingerprints_p1}}: Obake has a 25% chance to not leave UV evidence and has the ability to make UV evidence disappear faster.
{{wiki_obake_fingerprints_p2}}: У этого призрака также есть шанс оставить уникальные пальцы/отпечатки рук:
{{wiki_haunted_mirror_p1}}: Держать зеркало и активировать его, покажет вам любимую комнату призрака.
{{wiki_haunted_mirror_p2}}: Взгляд в зеркало будет истощать здравомыслие со скоростью 7,5% в секунду, с минимальной утечкой 20%.
{{wiki_haunted_mirror_p3}}: Зеркало сломается, если у пользователя заканчивается здравомыслие, будь то, используя его слишком долго или пытаясь использовать с разумным здравомыслом менее 20%. Разрыв зеркала начнет проклятую охоту.
{{wiki_haunted_mirror_p4}}: Используя зеркало, в любимой комнате призрака появится источник света. Другие игроки могут использовать это, чтобы помочь найти комнату.
{{wiki_haunted_mirror_p5}}: Другие игроки могут видеть комнату в зеркале, пока она используется.
{{wiki_monkey_paw_p1}}: Пользователь может пожелать пожелания обезьяне. Пожелания могут предоставить информацию и принудительную деятельность, но каждое желание составляет стоимость. После того, как будет выполнено действительное желание, палец на лапе будет свернуться вниз, и желание будет исполнено.
{{wiki_monkey_paw_p2}}: Призрак появляется в своем нынешнем месте
{{wiki_monkey_paw_p3}}: После мероприятия начнется охота, и игровое зрение потемнело на время охоты
{{wiki_monkey_paw_p4}}: Удваивает всю активность призраков в течение 2 минут
{{wiki_monkey_paw_p5}}: Выключатель установлен на разбитую и входную дверь заблокирован на 2 минуты
{{wiki_monkey_paw_p7}}: Устанавливает любимую комнату Призрака в случайную комнату и увеличивает текущую утечку здравомыслия на 50%
{{wiki_monkey_paw_h6}}: "Я бы хотел, чтобы призрак оказался в ловушке"
{{wiki_monkey_paw_p8}}: Призрак заперт в своей комнате в течение 1 минуты, где он не может охотиться, бродить или делать способности
{{wiki_monkey_paw_p9}}: Двери блокировки в комнате игрока и охота начинаются после 1 -минутного периода (25% двери разблокируются после льготного периода)
{{wiki_monkey_paw_p13}}: Разбивает свет в этой комнате, и призрак может почувствовать или слышать игрока на любом расстоянии
{{wiki_monkey_paw_p14}}: Разблокирует все выходные двери (работает во время охоты)
{{wiki_monkey_paw_p15}}: Мягкость игрока и затемненное зрение в течение 5 секунд
{{wiki_monkey_paw_p16}}: Удаляет 1 неверное доказательство из журнала и пересекает связанные призраки
{{wiki_monkey_paw_p17}}: Запускает охоту возле игрока и игрока, и звук уменьшится до смерти или конца раунда
{{wiki_monkey_paw_p20}}: Случайным образом выбирает одно из вышеупомянутых пожеланий
{{wiki_monkey_paw_p21}}: Количество расширенных пальцев на руке указывает на количество оставшихся пожеланий, которые могут быть предоставлены во время этого контракта.
{{wiki_monkey_paw_p22}}: Каждое желание может быть использовано только один раз за контракт. Задавая дубликату вопроса, заставит пальцы покататься.
{{wiki_music_box_p1}}: При использовании музыкальная коробка будет воспроизводить музыку на некоторое время. Если музыкальная коробка будет принесена в пределах 20 м призрака, призрак начнет петь, раздавая свое местоположение, но остается невидимым.
{{wiki_music_box_p2}}: Если коробка попадает в 5 м от призрака, призрак начнет событие, где он станет видимым, и начнет идти к коробке.
{{wiki_music_box_p3}}: Находясь в пределах 3 м от музыкальной коробки истощать 2,6% здравомыслия в секунду во время воспроизведения песни, в общей сложности 77% потеряно, если музыкальная коробка может играть в течение всей длины (при условии, что сток применяется в течение 30 секунд).
{{wiki_music_box_p4}}: Проклятая охота начнется, если произойдет какое -либо из следующих условий:
{{wiki_music_box_p5}}: Игрок бросает коробку вместо того, чтобы поместить ее, заставляя его захлопнуть
{{wiki_music_box_p6}}: Игрок достигает или находится на 0% здравомыслия
{{wiki_music_box_p7}}: Призрачное событие (где оно видно и идет к коробке) длится более 5 секунд
{{wiki_music_box_p9}}: Музыкальная коробка может закрыться, не запустив проклятую охоту, если ни один из игроков не находится в зоне расследования, или если призрак недостаточно близок к музыкальной коробке, прежде чем музыка перестанет играть.
{{wiki_ouija_board_p1}}: При использовании игрок может задавать вопросы и получать ответы относительно призрака или его местонахождения. Задавать действительный вопрос заставит Правление ответить, изложив свой ответ, используя Planchette. После того, как он задал вопросы, игрок должен попрощаться, чтобы закончить сессию.
{{wiki_ouija_board_p2}}: Дает нынешнюю комнату призрака (не любимая комната)
{{wiki_ouija_board_p4}}: Сообщает, находится ли призрак в той же комнате, что и игрок
{{wiki_ouija_board_p10}}: Ответ с тем, если призраки хотят остаться одни при использовании ящика для духа
{{wiki_ouija_board_p12}}: Возвращает нынешний возраст призрака. Если число меняется, призрак - это тай
{{wiki_ouija_board_p32}}: Если игрок уходит от доски, пока он активен, или если он попытается задать вопрос с 0% здравомыслием, доска будет светиться оранжевым, сломать и начать проклятую охоту.
{{wiki_summoning_circle_p1}}: Игрок может использовать легче, чтобы зажечь 5 красных свечей, которые окружают круг. Освещение всех 5 свечей инициирует событие, за которым следует проклятая охота.
{{wiki_summoning_circle_p2}}: Призрак будет телепортирован в круг, чтобы провести мероприятие, и будет ждать 5 секунд, прежде чем начать проклятую охоту.
{{wiki_summoning_circle_p3}}: Каждая свеча будет истощать 16% здравомыслия от каждого близлежащего игрока при освещении, истощая в общей сложности 80%, когда все свечи зажжены.
{{wiki_summoning_circle_p4}}: Призрак начнет проклятую охоту после события Summoning Circle.
{{wiki_summoning_circle_p5}}: Если последняя свеча освещена, когда у вас меньше 16% здравомыслия, то призрак будет вызван и пропустит событие, немедленно запустив охоту (не проклят, но может быть предотвращен только неиспользованным распятием 3 -го уровня).
{{wiki_summoning_circle_p6}}: Если призрак уже охотится, когда зажжена последняя свеча, охотничий призрак будет телепортироваться в круг вызова и продолжать охотиться с этого места.
{{wiki_summoning_circle_p7}}: Попытка зажечь любую свечу, которая не является последней свечей без достаточного количества здравомыслия, приведет к немедленному взорванию свечи.
{{wiki_summoning_circle_p8}}: Тень - единственный призрак, который может появиться в качестве теневой модели во время события Summoning Circle.
{{wiki_tarot_cards_p1}}: Игрок может нарисовать карту с палубы, по одному. Каждая карта выполнит какое -то действие, которое влияет либо на призрака, либо на игрока. Каждая колода будет содержать 10 случайных карт.
{{wiki_tarot_cards_p2}}: Удваивает всю деятельность призрака в течение 20 секунд.
{{wiki_tarot_cards_p4}}: Игрок, который рисует карту, будет испытывать либо усиление, либо потерю здравомыслия, в зависимости от цвета ожога карты.
{{wiki_tarot_cards_p8}}: При рисовании этой карты нет эффекта.
{{wiki_tarot_cards_p9}}: Случайно выбирает другую карту, чтобы появиться, прежде чем превратиться в дурака, когда она горит.
{{wiki_tarot_cards_p12}}: Выражает призрачное событие к ближайшему игроку к призраку.
{{wiki_tarot_cards_p16}}: Телепортирует призрака обратно в свою комнату -призраки и ловит его там на 1 минуту.
{{wiki_tarot_cards_p17}}: Это не влияет на охоты и призрачные события.
{{wiki_tarot_cards_p19}}: Игрок, который рисует карту, будет полностью восстановлен до 100%
{{wiki_tarot_cards_p21}}: Игрок, который рисует карту, будет мгновенно установить их здравомыслие до 0%.
{{wiki_tarot_cards_p23}}: Восстает случайно выбранного мертвого игрока в их трупе.
{{wiki_tarot_cards_p24}}:
If no one is currently dead, it will revive the next player who dies. Multiple cards do not stack.
(A player cannot die twice in the same hunt)
{{wiki_tarot_cards_p27}}: Если будет включен вариант сложности «дружелюбного призрака», это всегда превратится в «дурака».
{{wiki_voodoo_doll_p1}}: В кукле Voodoo есть серия булавок. Когда в куклу прижимается булавка, она заставляет призрака вести взаимодействие. ПИН -код, который нажимается, случайно.
{{wiki_voodoo_doll_p2}}: Каждый вывод, нажатый, истощает здравомыслие пользователя на 5% (сердечный штифт занимает 10%).
{{wiki_voodoo_doll_p3}}: Если PIN -булавка в сердце нажимается (или если разумность игрока составляет 0% при использовании куклы), он начинает проклятую охоту.
{{wiki_voodoo_doll_p4}}: Толкание штифта будет истощать 5%, но не будет взаимодействовать, если призрак не достаточно близко к чему -либо, чтобы взаимодействовать.
{{wiki_voodoo_doll_p5}}: Если здравомыслие игрока составляет 0%, все оставшиеся штифты будут сразу же нажать. Это приведет к тому, что множественные взаимодействия (по одному на PIN -контакт) произойдут одновременно и начнут проклятую охоту.
{{wiki_emf_using_tier_1_p1}}: Читатель EMF уровня 1 оснащен иглой, которая будет указывать на уровень ЭДС, указывая на (или рядом) число, соответствующее уровню. Следует отметить, что в целом иглу должна пройти мимо числа, чтобы его рассмотрели это число.
{{wiki_emf_using_tier_2_p1}}: Читатель EMF Tier 2 оснащен 5 светодиодными огнями различных цветов. Количество освещенных светодиодов указывает уровень ЭДС.
{{wiki_emf_using_tier_3_p1}}: Читатель EMF Tier 3 оснащен ЖК -экраном, который показывает уровень ЭДС, направление и расстояние до источника ЭДС. Уровень указан в верхней части каждой секции с помощью маленьких стержней. Количество показанных стержней указывает уровень ЭДС.
{{wiki_spirit_box_using_tier_1_p1}}: Белый/синий светодиод будет освещаться возле значка микрофона в правом нижнем углу, если игра может услышать ваш микрофон.
{{wiki_spirit_box_using_tier_1_p2}}: Светодиодное право призрака будет освещать красным, если игра признает действительный вопрос, но ответа не дается.
{{wiki_spirit_box_using_tier_1_p3}}: Светодиодное право призрачного иконы осветит белый, если призрак дал ответ на ваш вопрос.
{{wiki_spirit_box_using_tier_2_p1}}: Значок микрофона в верхней части левой части покажет, сможет ли игра услышать ваш микрофон.
{{wiki_spirit_box_using_tier_2_p2}}: Значок «x» в правом нижнем углу покажет, узнает ли игра действительный вопрос, но ответа не дано.
{{wiki_spirit_box_using_tier_2_p3}}: Значок призрака в правом нижнем углу покажет, дал ли призрак ответ на ваш вопрос.
{{wiki_spirit_box_using_tier_3_p1}}: Светодиод ниже «ввод микрофона» будет освещаться белым, если игра сможет услышать ваш микрофон.
{{wiki_spirit_box_using_tier_3_p2}}: Массив светодиодов ниже «Ответ» будет освещать красный, если игра признает действительный вопрос, но ответа не дает.
{{wiki_spirit_box_using_tier_3_p3}}: Массив светодиодов ниже «Ответ» будет освещаться белым, если призрак дал ответ на ваш вопрос.
{{wiki_spirit_box_questions_1_p1}}: Следующие вопросы можно задать, чтобы вернуть случайно выбранную «агрессивную» ответ
{{wiki_spirit_box_questions_2_p1}}: The following questions can be asked to indicate how close you are to ghost and if the ghost is in the same room
{{wiki_spirit_box_questions_3_p1}}: The following questions can be asked to return an age (not correlated to ghost model)
{{wiki_photo_camera_p1}}: The photo camera allows the user to take photos of various paranormal objects and events. To use it, simply point the camera at the item you want to photograph (Tier 2 and Tier 3 feature a screen to make this easier), and press the 'use' button to capture a photo.
{{wiki_photo_camera_p2}}: Once a photo is taken, as long as your journal is not full, you can view the photo you took in the media section of the journal.
{{wiki_photo_camera_p3}}: Some photos are worth more than others, to see a list of items that can be photographed, see Media >> Photo Camera.
{{wiki_video_camera_p1}}: The video camera can be used to find ghost orbs, be a camera for the in-truck CCTV, and to capture video media.
{{wiki_video_camera_p2}}: To find orbs, you can see them with night vision through the screen on the video camera or through the CCTV in the truck (click the 'use' button to toggle between normal and night vision.)
{{wiki_video_camera_p3}}: To use the camera for CCTV, simply use the 'place' button to set the video camera on a surface (you can also place a video camera on a tripod). Once placed, you can view and control the camera through the CCTV.
{{wiki_video_camera_p4}}: To capture media, point the video camera toward the object / entity you wish to capture. If the item you are pointed at is a valid item that can be recorded, you should see a frame appear on the video camera's screen along with a label stating what the object is or what it is doing. Once you see the frame and label, press and hold the 'use' button. If the action lasts long enough for the 'capture' animation to complete and 'save' icon to appear, then the video was successfully captured and will appear in the media section of the journal.
{{wiki_video_camera_p5}}: Some videos are worth more than others, to see a list of actions that can be recorded, see Media >> Video Camera.
{{wiki_sound_recorder_p1}}: The sound recorder can be used to record various paranormal sounds. To use it, press the the 'use' button to turn it on. On each tier of the sound recorder there is an indicator showing the level of audio that it can hear. Once the indicators get above a certain level (you may have to move closer to the sound in order for it to be loud enough), press and hold the 'use' button. Wait until the record indicator is gone, and if successful the audio clip will be saved in the media section of the journal.
{{wiki_sound_recorder_p2}}: Some recordings are worth more than others, to see a list of sounds that can be recorded, see Media >> Sound Recorder.
{{wiki_flickering_p1}}: During a hunt, ghosts will flicker in and out of existance, alternating between visible and invisible multiple times every few seconds. There are a couple of ghosts that can be identified by their flickering during a hunt: (1) an Oni will be more visible during a hunt, (2) a Deogen will be more visible during a hunt, and (3) the Phantom will be invisible for longer periods of time.
{{wiki_flickering_p2}}: Below you can see examples of the flicker timing of Phantom, Oni, Deogen, and all other ghosts.
{{wiki_flickering_p3}}: The Obake has an ability that will cause it to shapeshift during a hunt, meaning that the ghost model will change for a single blink
{{wiki_flickering_p5}}: Below you can see examples of a Normal ghost and then the Obake with its shapeshift
{{wiki_ghost_speed_p1}}: Many ghosts have a range of speeds that they can be. These are usually dependant on some other factor (such as sanity or temperature) and will cause the speed to be somewhere in-between the speeds listed on the cards
{{wiki_hunt_duration_p1}}: The time that a ghost hunts depends on many factors including the Hunt Duration setting and the size of the map. Harder difficulties and larger maps result in longer hunt times.
{{wiki_hunt_duration_p2}}: Using any Cursed Object to start a hunt will result in a cursed hunt that will extend the hunt for 20s regardless of the original length. All hunts following the first cursed hunt will have their length extended as well.
{{wiki_hunt_duration_p3}}: This setting will lengthen a hunt each time it kills a player, causing the duration to increase for that hunt only. The duration that a hunt is extended is also dependant on difficulty.
{{wiki_los_p1}}: Most ghosts will gradually increase their speed while they have line-of-sight (LOS) on a player up to a maximum of 1.65x their base speed. After breaking LOS, the ghost will maintain the increased speed until it reaches the last known player position. If it does not regain LOS at this point, the ghost will very slowly lose the increased speed.
{{wiki_los_p2}}: All ghosts have a standard LOS speed up except for: Revenant, Hantu, Deogen, and Thaye
{{wiki_los_p3}}: While using the BPM Finder, the cheat sheet will generate a plot of the speeds that you tapped over time. Many different hunting behaviors, including LOS, can be observed from this graph, as shown below.
{{wiki_los_normal_p1}}: A standard speed ghost will hunt at 1.7m/s. Once the ghost has LOS with the player (A), the ghost will increase in speed over 13 seconds of continuous LOS until a maximum speed of 1.65x base speed is reached (B).
{{wiki_los_twins_p1}}: The Twins move at different speeds when hunting. The main twin is 10% slower than a standard ghost, while the "roaming" twin is 10% faster.
{{wiki_los_twins_p2}}: The BPM Plot will keep a history of the previous hunt that was tapped as a dotted red line. Using this line you can see how the previous hunt compares to the current hunt. A different base speed can indicate the Twins.
{{wiki_los_twins_p3}}: In the example below, you can see that the previous hunt was at 1.5m/s while the next hunt was at 1.9m/s.
{{wiki_los_raiju_p1}}: A Raiju always moves at a fixed speed of 2.5m/s (at 100% ghost speed) while near active electronic player equipment both placed or held. This results in flat spots near 2.5m/s interrupting an otherwise standard hunting pattern.
{{wiki_los_raiju_p2}}: In the following example, the Raiju came into range of electronics (A) and immediately sped up until it was out of range (B). The Raiju then gained LOS (C) and began the standard increase until it came into electronic range again (D). Once it left the range of electronics, the Raiju's speed returned to that of its LOS increase (E) and continued to increase LOS speed until it reached its max LOS speed (F).
{{wiki_los_raiju_p3}}: The Raiju's biggest tell is multiple flat spots at 2.5m/s (A-B & D-E).
{{wiki_los_revenant_p1}}: Revenants do not follow a standard LOS increase. Instead, they have a base speed of 1.0m/s until they detect a player (A), whether by sight, sound, or electronic use. They will immediately speed up to 3.0m/s until they can no longer detect the player and have reached the last known location of the player (B). At that point, they will gradually decrease back down to 1.0m/s (C).
{{wiki_los_hantu_p1}}: The Hantu has no LOS increase, but its speed is based on the temperature of the room it is currently in. This leads to very variable speeds while hunting IF it wanders through multiple different temperature rooms during a hunt. The longer a Hantu is in a room, the colder it will get, and this will affect its speed.
{{wiki_los_moroi_p1}}: A Moroi's speed is dependent on the team's average sanity. At 0% sanity, a Moroi's base speed starts at 2.25m/s until it has LOS (A). With 13 seconds of continuous LOS, a Moroi can max out at 3.71m/s (D), the fastest of any ghost.
{{wiki_los_moroi_p2}}: A Moroi also has the longest "blindness" period when smudged of any ghost. If a Moroi has a LOS speed increase when smudged with a Tier 1 incense (B), the speed will return to the base speed of 2.25m/s for 7 seconds (instead of the standard 5 seconds). After the smudge wears off, if there was any remaining LOS speed, it will return to that speed. If LOS is regained at that point (C), the speed will continue to increase.
{{wiki_los_thaye_p1}}: The Moroi and Thaye are some of the fastest ghosts in the game and are sometimes hard to distinguish, but there is a key difference: a Thaye will never speed up with LOS.
{{wiki_los_thaye_p2}}: Thayes age and grow weaker and slower the longer players are around them. The youngest Thaye will always move at 2.75m/s at 100% speed, even with LOS, and will become slower with each hunt if exposed to players.
{{wiki_los_thaye_p3}}: Moroi without LOS will be slower than young Thayes, moving at only 2.25m/s (dotted line), but they are able to reach a speed much faster than Thayes while in continuous LOS (solid line).
{{wiki_los_deogen_p1}}: Deogens do not have a LOS speed up. Instead, they are always able to sense their target and will move at 3.0m/s until they are close to the targeted player and will slow down to 0.4m/s.
{{wiki_los_mimic_p1}}: The Mimic is capable of ANY hunt pattern and should be remembered.
{{wiki_media_photo_intro}}: Below is a list of things that you are able to photograph in-game. To see how to use a photo camera, see Equipment >> Photo Camera.
{{wiki_media_photo_n11}}: EMF 5 is not considered different than EMF for photos
{{wiki_media_video_intro}}: Below is a list of things that you are able to record with a video camera in-game. To see how to use a video camera, see Equipment >> Video Camera.
{{wiki_media_video_a3}}: Player being killed by the ghost
{{wiki_media_sound_intro}}: Below is a list of things that you are able to record with a sound recorder in-game. To see how to use a sound recorder, see Equipment >> Sound Recorder.
{{wiki_misconceptions_spirit_1_c}}: "Only a Spirit will take 180 seconds to hunt again after being smudged."
{{wiki_misconceptions_spirit_1_r}}: Any ghost can take 180 seconds to hunt again after being smudged, but Spirit must wait this long.
{{wiki_misconceptions_wraith_1_c}}: "The Wraith can walk through walls and see through doors"
{{wiki_misconceptions_wraith_1_r}}: False, this is a misinterpretation of the flavor text in the in-game journal. The Wraith tracks and paths identically to other ghosts during hunts.
{{wiki_misconceptions_phantom_1_c}}: "The Phantom will not appear in any photos"
{{wiki_misconceptions_phantom_1_r}}: In order for the Phantom to disappear from a photo and not be visible, the photo must be labelled as a "Ghost" photo in the journal
{{wiki_misconceptions_banshee_1_c}}: "Only a Banshee's target can hear the Banshee's scream through a parabolic microphone"
{{wiki_misconceptions_banshee_1_r}}: Any player can hear the Banshee's scream through the parabolic microphone
{{wiki_misconceptions_banshee_2_c}}: "The ghost only hunts based on the sanity of people in the house / investigation area"
{{wiki_misconceptions_banshee_2_r}}: The ghost will hunt based on the team's average sanity regardless of where those team members are. The Banshee is the only exception to this as they will hunt based on their target's sanity (but it still doesn't matter if the target is inside or outside).
{{wiki_misconceptions_banshee_3_c}}: "If the ghost hunts from another room or another room gets cold that means the ghost changed rooms"
{{wiki_misconceptions_banshee_3_r}}: False. Ghosts can hunt from wherever they happen to be at the time. Since ghosts can roam out of their rooms, they can hunt from anywhere the roam takes them. As far as temperatures go, the temps will drop in any room that the ghost has spent time in, which can be the result of roaming frequently or stalking behavior (Banshee). The only way to confirm a room change is to observe ghost orbs being in a different room than before or if the mirror shows a new room.
{{wiki_misconceptions_mare_1_c}}: "Mare will wander from lit rooms to dark rooms"
{{wiki_misconceptions_mare_1_r}}: This is not quite accurate. The Mare will simply roam more if the lights are on in its current room, causing it to leave more often but with no affinity for ending up in a dark room.
{{wiki_misconceptions_shade_1_c}}: "A shade will not hunt if you are in the ghost's favorite room"
{{wiki_misconceptions_shade_1_r}}: This behavior of the Shade is not limited to just the favorite room. A Shade will not perform any action that results in an EMF reading or hunt while in the same room as the player, favorite room or not. It is possible for the ghost to wander out of the room and hunt from an adjacent room or reach back into the room to interact with objects.
{{wiki_misconceptions_oni_1_c}}: "If I hear a "hiss" from an event, it was an airball / ghost mist event"
{{wiki_misconceptions_oni_1_r}}: While this event does produce this sound, the walking manifestation event can also produce the same "hiss" sound. Be sure you saw the airball / ghost mist before ruling out Oni.
{{wiki_misconceptions_hantu_1_c}}: "The Hantu chills a room faster" or "The Hantu is colder than other ghosts with Freezing Temps"
{{wiki_misconceptions_hantu_1_r}}: False, during hunts, the Hantu moves faster in colder rooms, but it does not make rooms colder faster or reach a lower temperature than other ghosts.
{{wiki_misconceptions_goryo_1_c}}: "If the bone is in the ghost's favorite room, it is a Goryo"
{{wiki_misconceptions_goryo_1_r}}: False, this is simply RNG. The bone can happen to be in the ghost's favorite room of any ghost.
{{wiki_misconceptions_myling_1_c}}: "The Myling can't make vocal sounds during a hunt"
{{wiki_misconceptions_myling_1_r}}: False, the Myling can make vocal sounds during hunts just like any other ghost. The Myling also stops being heard from 12m away instead of 20m, which indirectly does cause them to be slightly quiter at the same distance as a normal ghost.
{{wiki_misconceptions_onryo_1_c}}: "Onryo will actively try to avoid firelights and will move away from them"
{{wiki_misconceptions_onryo_1_r}}: False, this is derived from the flavor text of the in-game journal. Onryos don't avoid firelights, they simply blow out a firelight instead of using a crucifix if they attempt to hunt within range of one.
{{wiki_misconceptions_onryo_2_c}}: "Onryo only has a chance to hunt after blowing out 3 flames" or "Onryo has a chance to hunt after blowing out a every flame after the initial 3"
{{wiki_misconceptions_onryo_2_r}}: Onryo will always attempt to hunt after blowing out every 3rd flame. Note: It queues the hunt after the 3rd blowout but if it can't initiate it (because of an existing hunt or a cooldown) then it will get delayed (after the cooldown smudge timers also delay the hunt) and any candles blown during that time won't count towards the cycle (as the counter will only get reset at the start of the ability hunt).
{{wiki_misconceptions_twins_1_r}}: The Twins is a single ghost with 2 interaction ranges; one larger and one smaller
{{wiki_misconceptions_twins_2_c}}: "You can tell it's The Twins by a 'curve' on the activity board (Twinteraction)"
{{wiki_misconceptions_twins_2_r}}: False. Although The Twins are more likely to produce this pattern on the activity board because of their ability, any ghost is able to produce that pattern by doing multiple interactions in quick succession.
{{wiki_misconceptions_obake_1_c}}: "Two left footprints or two right footprints in a row mean the ghost missed a step"
{{wiki_misconceptions_obake_1_r}}: False, there is no rhyme or reason to the footstep orientation as any ghost can leave multiple left or multiple right footprints in a row.
{{wiki_misconceptions_obake_2_c}}: "Any ghost can miss a footstep after stepping in salt if they stop walking and then start walking again"
{{wiki_misconceptions_obake_2_r}}: After stepping in salt, a ghost will leave 0 - 4 audible footsteps (with UV footprint if ghost has UV). If at any point the ghost stops, the footsteps will stop too and not resume after the ghost starts moving again.
{{wiki_misconceptions_mimic_1_c}}: "Mimic orbs follow the ghost and don't stay in the favorite room"
{{wiki_misconceptions_mimic_1_r}}: False, this was a rumor started by a YouTuber. Mimic orbs behave identically to other ghosts orbs and will remain in the favorite room. They also do not have any visual differences.
{{wiki_misconceptions_mimic_2_c}}: "Guaranteed evidence means it can still be found on 0 evidence games"
{{wiki_misconceptions_mimic_2_r}}: There is 0 evidence in 0 evidence games. Guaranteed evidence simply means that if an evidence is available, those ghosts with said evidences must show those evidences. On 0 evidence games they won't show any evidence, including guaranteed ones. The only exception to this is Mimic orbs because they are an ability and not an actual evidence.
{{wiki_misconceptions_emf_1_c}}: "EMF 10 on the board means an event or a hunt"
{{wiki_misconceptions_emf_1_r}}: Though this may be because of a hunt or event, the activity monitor displays the total EMF activity in the map. Because of that you can get to 10 with a few interactions as well
{{wiki_misconceptions_freezing_1_c}}: "Seeing your breath means the ghost has freezing temperatures"
{{wiki_misconceptions_freezing_1_r}}: Not any more. This used to be the case, but ever since v0.9.0.0 you can see your breath with any temperature lower than 5° Celsius
{{wiki_misconceptions_comms_1_c}}: "What the comms guy says at the beginning of a contract gives us some clues"
{{wiki_misconceptions_comms_1_r}}: Not at all. It is only flavor text as confirmed by the devs.
{{wiki_misconceptions_ouija_1_c}}: "The Ouija board tells you the ghost's favorite room"
{{wiki_misconceptions_ouija_1_r}}: The Ouija board will tell you the ghost's current location. Only the mirror will show you the favorite room.
{{wiki_misconceptions_radio_1_c}}: "Using the global radio during a hunt will cause the ghost to sense other players"
{{wiki_misconceptions_radio_1_r}}: Using the global radio will only alert the ghost to your position as it counts as turning on a held electronic device.
{{wiki_misconceptions_insurance_1_c}}: "You have to take photos of dead teammates to get insurance money"
{{wiki_misconceptions_insurance_1_r}}: Insurance is based on difficulty and if you die, no photo necessary.
{{wiki_achievement_hunter_p1}}: "Prove your worth, discover every secret and conquer every challenge."
{{wiki_achievement_hunter_p3}}: Once completed you will be awarded the following:
{{wiki_apoc_bronze_p1}}: "The Apocalypse has begun, show how skilled you really are!"
{{wiki_apoc_bronze_p5}}: Complete all objectives (get ghost correct and complete all 3 optional objectives)
{{wiki_apoc_bronze_p6}}: Capture a ghost photo ("Ghost", "Translucent Ghost", or "Shadow Ghost" in the journal)
{{wiki_apoc_bronze_p8}}: Once completed you will be awarded the following:
{{wiki_apoc_silver_p1}}: "The Apocalypse continues, can you master it?"
{{wiki_apoc_silver_p5}}: Complete all objectives (get ghost correct and complete all 3 optional objectives)
{{wiki_apoc_silver_p6}}: Capture a ghost photo ("Ghost", "Translucent Ghost", or "Shadow Ghost" in the journal)
{{wiki_apoc_silver_p8}}: Once completed you will be awarded the following along with the rewards from 'Apocalypse Adept':
{{wiki_apoc_gold_p1}}: "The hardest challenge we can offer. Good luck, you'll need it."
{{wiki_apoc_gold_p5}}: Complete all objectives (get ghost correct and complete all 3 optional objectives)
{{wiki_apoc_gold_p6}}: Capture a ghost photo ("Ghost", "Translucent Ghost", or "Shadow Ghost" in the journal)
{{wiki_apoc_gold_p8}}: Once completed you will be awarded the following along with the rewards from 'Apocalypse Master' and 'Apocalypse Adept':
{{wiki_farmhouse_fieldwork_p1}}: "Paranormal entities have overwhelmed the farmlands. It's time to get them out..."
{{wiki_farmhouse_fieldwork_p4}}: Get the ghost correct and survive 50 times
{{wiki_farmhouse_fieldwork_p5}}: Once completed you will be awarded the following:
{{wiki_ferryman_p2}}: Solve the locked lantern cabinet puzzle
{{wiki_ferryman_p7}}: Clue: On the wall to the right of the stairs going up, there are 3 photos of various, colored sea shells (green, blue, and orange)
{{wiki_ferryman_p13}}: Hint: The color and order of the sea shell photos correspond to the next action you must take
{{wiki_ferryman_p15}}: Solution: On the pool table, pocket the three pool balls that correspond to the sea shells colors in the same order of the shell photos from left to right (green -> blue -> orange). Once that is complete you will hear a "clink" sound, go and grab the key that is now in the ball return slot of the pool table.
{{wiki_ferryman_p23}}: Solution: As soon as you enter the lantern room, turn right and there should be a locked cabinet. Open the cabinet to reveal the outline of a missing gear.
{{wiki_ferryman_p29}}: Hint: There has to be a gear that will fit the slot somewhere around here...
{{wiki_ferryman_p31}}: Solution: The gear can be found leaning against the cabinet to the left of the table with a rocking horse on it. Pick up this gear with an open inventory slot.
{{wiki_ferryman_p37}}: Hint: That's right, it goes in the square hole...
{{wiki_ferryman_p39}}: Solution: Back in the cabinet that you unlocked, place the gear into the slot. This will cause the lighthouse lantern to start flashing in groups of 3.
{{wiki_ferryman_p45}}: Hint: What other way could you alert an incoming ship?
{{wiki_ferryman_p47}}: Solution: While outside, ring the giant bell 3 times. Once completed you should hear a "thud" or a "whoosh" sound and the lighthouse lantern will stop flashing.
{{wiki_ferryman_p55}}: Solution: While on the balcony, look down toward the beach. You should see that a fire is now burning and is illuminating a cave entrance. Near the fire are some rocks spelling out "UV".
{{wiki_ferryman_p61}}: Hint: UV can show what can't normally be seen
{{wiki_ferryman_p63}}: Solution: Take a UV Light and shine it on the base of the rotating lantern. The base should start to glow while its charging. Continue charging it until it no longer is glowing and the lighthouse is emitting UV light.
{{wiki_ferryman_p69}}: Solution: Stand on the balcony while the lighthouse is emitting UV light. As it rotates it will reveal the eerie sight of the spirits of many dead sailors.
{{wiki_ferryman_p71}}: Once completed you will be awarded the following:
{{wiki_lighthouse_keeper_p1}}: "Drowned souls haunt this recently evacuated tower. Can you save Point Hope?"
{{wiki_lighthouse_keeper_p3}}: Get the ghost correct and survive 50 times
{{wiki_lighthouse_keeper_p4}}: Once completed you will be awarded the following:
{{wiki_ranger_challenge_p1}}: "The campsites could be evacuated forever, we need your help!"
{{wiki_ranger_challenge_p4}}: Get the ghost correct and survive 50 times
{{wiki_ranger_challenge_p5}}: Once completed you will be awarded the following:
{{wiki_sm_survival_p1}}: "Will you conquer the maze of hallways and abandoned rooms?"
{{wiki_sm_survival_p4}}: Get the ghost correct and survive 50 times
{{wiki_sm_survival_p5}}: Once completed you will be awarded the following:
{{wiki_blood_moon_p6}}: This weather has a 2% chance to appear on any map (even when weather is set in custom difficulty). It cannot be selected in custom difficulty nor requested using the monkey paw.
{{wiki_blood_moon_p7}}: Blood Moon weather has light rain that provides some light environmental sound that is constant, but not usually loud enough to drown out the sound of equipment and most interactions. It also does not extinguish nor prevent the lighting of firelights and igniters.
{{wiki_blood_moon_p8}}: The Blood Moon causes the following modifiers:
{{wiki_blood_moon_p9}}: Ghost speed is 15% faster during hunts
{{wiki_blood_moon_p13}}: The cheat sheet will account for this if you turn on Blood Moon mode.
{{wiki_fog_p6}}: In this weather, vision is greatly reduced outdoors but fades off quickly near indoor areas.
{{wiki_fog_p7}}: This means that it doesn't impact indoor maps other than making outdoor security cameras difficult to use, but it does greatly decrease visibility on outdoor maps, such as Woodwind and Maple Lodge.
{{wiki_fog_p8}}: The ghost's vision is not impacted by foggy weather.
{{wiki_heavy_rain_p6}}: Heavy rain brings very loud environmental noise which can make it difficult to hear many interactions.
{{wiki_heavy_rain_p7}}: The sound carries inside of many areas of various maps as the rain hitting the roof produces its own sound as well.
{{wiki_heavy_rain_p8}}: Heavy rain also prevents Tier 1 / 2 firelights and igniters from being lit in the rain and will extinguish them immediately if brought in the rain.
{{wiki_heavy_rain_p9}}: In addition to the heavy rain, this weather also produces occasional flashes of lighting with accompanying thunder.
{{wiki_heavy_rain_p10}}: The thunder last for a couple of seconds and is loud enough that it can drown out all other sound, making it hard to track ghost footsteps or hear equipment.
{{wiki_heavy_rain_p11}}: However, the lightning does produce a few seconds of very bright light that can illuminate the map and allow the player to see.
{{wiki_light_rain_p6}}: Light rain provides some light environmental sound that is constant, but not usually loud enough to drown out the sound of equipment and most interactions. It also does not extinguish nor prevent the lighting of firelights and igniters.
{{wiki_snow_p6}}: Snow weather provides a light mist around the outdoor areas of the map which provides modest visibility, but is usually not a hinderance to gameplay.
{{wiki_snow_p7}}: The lower ambient temperature means that if the breaker is off and a room has had time to cool down, you will be able to see your breath in that room. For higher difficulties that start with the breaker off or broken, you will be able to see your breath in every room inside the map. This can make it difficult to locate the ghost's current room as it masks a strong indicator of the ghost having dropped the temperature in their immediate area.
{{wiki_snow_p8}}: The falling snow makes it difficult to see Ghost Orbs evidence, meaning that snow on outdoors maps and any snow that clips through the ceiling of indoor maps require extra attention as to not confuse Ghost Orbs with falling snow.
{{wiki_sunrise_p6}}: The sunrise provides much more additional ambient lighting, which greatly illuminates outdoor areas and any rooms where sunlight is coming through the windows.
{{wiki_windy_p6}}: Windy weather has the same visibility and lighting as clear weather, but provides the additional environmental sound of wind blowing through trees and the rustling of leaves. It is generally not loud enough to drown out the sound of equipment and most interactions.
{{wiki_xp_grinding_p3}}: The goal of this strategy is to go in long enough to survive a single hunt (2 if you value correctness over number of attempts) and leave. It requires a decent understanding of ghost behaviour during hunts and the ability to loop a ghost. This strat is done ideally with 2+ players, but it is possible to do in single player.
{{wiki_xp_grinding_p4}}: You will want to equip a loadout that at a minimum has incense (I prefer Tier 1 so the ghost will run away and not hang around), ignitors, salt (preferably tier 2 or 3), and a device that can be left on to test for raiju (I usually go with an EMF reader or another device that will help complete an objective, such as a paramic).
{{wiki_xp_grinding_p5}}: (Single Player) To start, grab the electronic device, turn it on and throw it just inside the gate (this will be used for testing for Raiju). Then grab salt, an igniter, and an incense.
{{wiki_xp_grinding_p6}}: (Multiplayer) Have one player grab an igniter and 2 incense and the other player grab salt, an electronic device (for testing raiju and/or completing objectives), and any other equipment that could be used to complete other objectives.
{{wiki_xp_grinding_p7}}: Head toward either the picnic tables just inside the gate or to the campfire in the middle of the logs. Place your salt on the ground in a location the ghost will likely walk through (opening to the campfire circle or in between the picnic tables). Then wait for the ghost to hunt.
{{wiki_xp_grinding_p8}}: Once the ghost begins to hunt, start to identify what it is based on behaviour (footstep speed, flicker/blink rate, speed up near electronics, freezing breath, etc). Continue to loop the ghost around the campfire / picnic tables and smudge if needed.
{{wiki_xp_grinding_p9}}: Note: As of v0.9.2.0 the campfire no longer breaks line-of-sight.
{{wiki_xp_grinding_p10}}: After the hunt is over, you can either use a timer to narrow down if it is a spirit or demon based on smudge cooldown (this takes quite a bit of time, but allows time to complete more objectives), or you can guess the ghost and leave. This entire process can be done in under 2 minutes if optimized and rewards between 2000xp - 5000xp for correct ghost and completed objectives.
